about_the_product.title: META WAYFARER Sunglasses in Black and Clear/Graphite Green - | Ray-Ban® US
about_the_product.description: Blending cutting-edge technology with timeless style, Meta's latest smart glasses are designed to complement your life. They're hands-free and fashion-forward. These aren’t just wearables; they’re intelligent accessories that fit effortlessly into your day, featuring a shiny Black Frame and G-15 Green lenses. With just a simple “Hey Meta,” your voice becomes the key to instant translation, on-the-go search, QR scanning, and real-time assistance—whether exploring a new city, capturing content, or managing your schedule. It’s your assistant, built right into your frames. The ultra-wide 12 MP camera and five-microphone system let you capture the world exactly as you see and hear it, from candid moments to immersive video. Seamlessly livestream or switch between your phone and glasses camera during video calls for a uniquely personal perspective. Crafted with open-ear audio and enhanced directional sound, the listening experience is rich yet discreet—even in lively or windy settings. Whether taking calls or tuning into your playlist, the sound stays yours alone. Effortless touch controls and intuitive voice commands let you snap photos, send messages, or manage media—no need to reach for your phone. And with a compact charging case offering up to 32 hours of use, your glasses are ready wherever the day (or night) takes you. Enhance the experience with the Meta View app, which allows you to edit, add effects, and share your content easily—all from one elegant interface. Innovation meets everyday luxury. Explore life through a new lens.

items.title: Ray-Ban Meta Wayfarer Review

user_reviews.title: Meh.
user_reviews.text:
I've had these for almost 4 months now and here are my pros and cons.

Pro- camera on your face, headphones built in, translates other languages well, tells me what I'm looking at when I ask. The transition lenses are great and allows me to wear these anywhere at anytime.

Cons- They are quite heavy and hurt the nose after a while.

-The camera quality is alright, but you cannot zoom in/out, do live feeds, or even view what your camera sees on the app. It's take a picture and what you get is what you get.

-The microphone quality sucks. The sound quality between recording from your glasses vs. your phone is vast. Not recommended for concerts, which is one of the things I was excited to use them at.

-Headphones aren't great. It's a lot of highs with little lows. The second to max volume isn't quite loud enough for street use, but max volume is screaming in your ears. I should have expected this since nothing goes in the ear. Also, they change volume automatically all the time, depending on how loud the surrounding noise is. I had to turn this feature off as it was very frustrating.

-Touch controls are also not great. I will pause my music and have a 10 second conversation, then find myself often pressing "play" over and over trying to resume my music, until it either finally plays, or I give up and have to open the app and press play on my phone. This might be the most annoying issue for me.

Video is limited to a maximum of 3 minutes.

Video recording drains the battery so fast. You might get 15-20 minutes of footage from 100% full to dead.

-Battery life in general isn't great. They can only last a few hours with minimal use before needing a charge.

-If you lose the case, the glasses are useless. There is no way to change them without the specific charging case. I guess it's the same with most wireless ear buds these days, but I feel they could have snuck a usbc port somewhere on them.

All in all, I would hold off on getting these for at least this generation. It's a great idea and I'm glad the technology is now, but it's far from perfect.

user_reviews.title: Really Impressed
user_reviews.text:
I have been using Ray Ban sunglasses for many years and have been impressed that they are not only good at their job but seem to survive my casual handling. When I first saw these the combination of Ray Ban quality and satisfying my love of interactive gadgets was too good to miss.

Everything these days needs an app and the first job with these was to download the app on my iPhone. Everything linked together OK and I was immediately reviewing surprisingly high quality audio from music on my iPhone. Then tried taking pictures. Again really easy but it took a while to work out the sequence of the glasses sending the picture to the Meta app on my phone which in turn sends them to my picture folder. I am still not totally convinced I totally understand as sometimes it happens nearly instantly and at other times takes a while.

One real surprise is that the quality of the pictures and video is amazing from the tiny lens. It is a really discrete way of recording photos but note that when it records it flashes a small light on the side of the frame so any subject will realise something is happening. I guess that I will still favour my phone for pictures as I can more easily frame what I am shooting but the AI in the specs results in pictures that are a lot better than I expected. The only snag for me is I tend to prefer to record in landscape but the pictures are always portrait as there is no logical way of turning the glasses 90 degrees. The glasses are also quick to use as it is just a case of tapping a button or I can say "Hey Meta take a picture".

Now to actually using these as sunglasses. They do the job really well and are very comfortable for extended wear. They are so good that I have an appointment for an eye test as I now plan to get them fitted with prescription lenses so they become my daily wear.

An unexpected feature is being able to ask on line questions by saying something like "Hey Meta what's the weather like today" The only snag being that the glasses don't know where they are so one needs to add something like "in London, UK". The answers are quick and clear but there is a clear USA influence as temperatures are always given in Fahrenheit !!

Finally charging. So far I have not used the glasses for long periods and think that I will still favour my iPhone for pictures and my EarPods for extended listening. Charging is however just a case of charging the case from any USB charger and then the glasses charge just by putting them in the case. I am still working on how long the power in the glasses will last but assume that for extensive use for music and pictures I will have to put them on the charger at some time so maybe not good to rely on them all day other than for "looking".

user_reviews.title: Beware dont buy
user_reviews.text: These glasses are the epitome of a waste of money, not only have I gone through three pairs that have either broken cannot connect or will not charge and have the worst time trying to either exchange or return them because they are in such high popular demand that they cannot keep them in stock so once you get your defected pair and pay for it you have to wait another two weeks to a month in order for them to replace it with another pair that doesn’t work I highly suggest going to either Oakley Maui gym or Shady rays. They are much better and if you’re looking for AI glasses the Oakley’s although they don’t have the best frames, the technology seems to be working much Better

user_reviews.title: Pretty cool sometimes
user_reviews.text: I like them then I don’t like them. I got transitions because wanted to use more. I don’t like them on me when clear (look funny). But I like them when clear for function. I got them for first person in my airplane. No more GoPro strapped to my head. The easy of use tap the button forget and live in the moment really works well. The videos are awesome. Get my hat sometimes and sometimes hat denies it from taking the shot. Think I would have loved non transition but then loose the twilight and night use. I would buy again thinking of buying another just to have some that don’t transition for when I know won’t be out in the dark. Wish I could share video. Check out @l4_46 on tiktok for video. Thanks

user_reviews.title: Worth every penny and exceeds the hype
user_reviews.text:
Work better than expected. A comfortable fit, stylish sunglasses with all the added extras. The simplicity of using them and the ease of natural photos create lovely moments captured on camera.
So good !!

user_reviews.title: Brilliant Tech
user_reviews.text: Saw all the reviews on YouTube and instagram and was excited to try them out. I was not disappointed as they are so convenient and brilliant for content creation. I recently visited Amsterdam with my partner and the content I picked up whilst wearing them was much easier to capture than using my phone plus the picture and video quality is really great. Very happy with my purchase ☺️

user_reviews.title: Cheap 12mp glasses that look worn down and beat after only a few uses
user_reviews.text: The coating in the center delaminated within 60 days and target won’t accept a refund. They gave contact info for meta guest relations and Marianne didn’t reply to my email.

items.snippet: Here's what I liked and didn't like: Number one: I'm a big fan of the USB Type-C charging on the back of the glasses you could definitely use them all day long.
It fits on the bridge of the glasses with a USB-C cable attached to the arm, allowing you to charge the glasses infinitely.
Not a fan of the gloss surface since it's a smudge magnet and imho makes the glasses look less premium.

items.snippet: You can also do a factory reset if you cannot connect to the app, by hitting the capture button 5 times then holding it down till it resets.
What about the on/off button? Call me slow or whatever but I didnt discover that button until mine wasn't charging. Found that button, turned it off and charged them in the case.
After latest ``update'' the battery is not even lasting an entire day and it randomly shuts off and won't come back on until I put it on the charger.
However, the camera wasn't great for action shots and the battery didn't last long enough for my purposes.
So, the latest gen 2 has an improved camera and faster/darker transition lenses.

items.snippet: Anyone figure this out mine and my co workers just started doing this a couple days ago. Seems like the update messed them up
I have the same problem, so I'm returning them and buying new ones. less than one month in use.
So only my old phone which is on android 13 works properly, but android 14 hates these glasses and won't connect the bluetooth audio properly.
These seem like clear manufacturer defects, but here's the kicker: after the 12-month warranty, Meta and Ray-Ban provide ZERO support--paid or otherwise.
When I accept phone calls, I can clearly hear the caller voice but the caller can barely hear my voice.
